Romania.title: Romania

Description.text:
On the 1st of July the Romanian Cluster Association establishment meeting took place, among the founding members15 clusters are found, namely:

  1. The North-East ASTRICO Textile Cluster, Piatra Neamţ, represented by the ASTRICO Association
  2. The „Traditions-Manufacturing-Future” SE Textile Cluster, Focşani, represented by the Traditions Manufacturing Future Association
  3. The South-East Maritime Cluster, Constanţa, represented by the Ronomar Foundation
  4. The “Innovative Building” Bucharest Cluster, represented by IDS Architecture Construction Ltd.
  5. The Romanian Textile Concept Bucharest Cluster, represented by the Romanian Textile Concept Association
  6. The Agro Food Cluster, Bucharest, Ilfov, represented by INMA
  7. The Elinclus Electronic Cluster Bucharest, represented by the Association for Promoting Electronic Technology
  8. The ICT South-West Cluster, represented by ARIES Oltenia
  9. The South-West Tourism Cluster, represented by the Association for Promoting Tourism Mehedinţi
  10. The Agro Food West Cluster, represented by the Arad Chamber of Commerce, Industry and Agriculture
  11. The Renerg Center Cluster, represented by the Agency for Regional Development Center
  12. The Green Energy Covasna Cluster, represented by the Green Energy Association
  13. The Agro Food Covasna Cluster, represented by ASIMCOV
  14. The Pro Wood Covasna Cluster, represented by the KOFA Association
  15. The Electrotechnical ETREC Center Cluster, represented by the Regional Electrotechnical Cluster Association ASCRET Braşov

Meanwhile, other clusters have also joined:

  1. The ROSENC Cluster in the field of renewable energy, located in the West region.
  2. The Mechatrec Cluster in mechatronics, located in the Bucharest – Ilfov area.
  3. The Cluj IT Cluster, IT related, located in the NW region.
  4. The IMAGO MOL Cluster in the field of medical imaging, located in the NE region.
  5. The PRELMET Cluster in the field of metal processing, located in the Center.
  6. The Inovtrans Cluster (intelligent transport), located in Bucharest, Ilfov area.

The aim of the association consists in advertising Romania and in the country’s economic recovery and development, by supporting the creation, development and cooperation between clusters at regional, national and international level.

The association’s object consists in:

· information: on regulations regarding the clusters’ activity, sources and possibilities of financing, events, etc.

· support and consulting for: the establishment, development and collaboration within and between clusters through network formation, etc.

· supporting members’ interests at national level in their relations with national and international bodies (the Romanian Government, the European Union,etc.)

· promoting members through various means and at all levels (regional, national, international), as well as sustaining clusters in developing branding strategies and organizing national and international advertising events (fairs, exhibitions, economic missions, conferences, etc.)

· monitoring and assessing cluster performance, based on criteria established of mutual consent by the members, as well as the exchange of national, regional and international best practices, in order to develop and implement an Ethical Code for Best Practices at national level

· research in the cluster field and development of diagnoses, prognoses, policies and strategies

· organizing courses, specific training

· taking part in various projects and partnerships in order to reach the intended goal

· conducting activities for accrediting/certifying clusters

The Association remains open to the accession of all Romanian clusters. From the Association’s point of view, the cluster must necessarily contain:

1. The Economic pillar (industry and/or services): a significant number of companies from the domain in which the cluster operates. In addition, the cluster may include organizations representing groups of companies (e.g. professional associations, etc.).

2. The Education-Research-Development pillar: universities, research institutes (or any other institutions that conduct research-development activities)

3. The Public Authorities pillar, at national (Ministries, etc.), regional (Agencies for Regional Development, county Councils), local level (local Councils, City Halls, etc.)

It is considered to be very useful to complete the classic model with catalyst organizations: technological transfer and innovation entities, chambers of commerce, consulting firms, etc.



The Romanian Cluster Association’s activity is conducted on 3 levels:

The association’s level, involving representation and lobby activities, support for generating clusters and for internationalizing them;

The level of the companies which ensure the cluster’s management, involving training and consulting activities;

The members’ level, particularly SMEs, involving activities for supporting their internationalization by taking part in international fairs and exhibitions, economic missions; consulting for accessing public funding for the development of the SMEs’ activities, management consulting.
